Comments_Questions: How clearly did the instructor define the topic of study
How clearly did the instructor outline the expectation for the course, classroom activity and homework
How well were individual class sessions prepared and presented
How well did lectures fit within the boundaries of the course
How available was the instructor for help outside the classroom
How useful were assignments in furthering an understanding of the topic
If tests were given, how fairly did they measure knowledge gained?
How useful was this course in preparing you for production work
How would you evaluate the instructor's knowledge of the material
Please offer additional comments on such topics as: what worked best about the course, suggested improvements, class materials, etc.
Comments_List:
I think Erich is an excellent resource. Any failure or lack of understanding on my end is merely due to my hard-headed nature of trying to figure things out on my own before asking for help- I usually waste an unfortunate amount of time with this methodology. I feel like I learned a lot- definitely enough to communicate what I want out of a Beckhoff system, and would have learned even more if I had a more open production schedule this semester.

The syllabus was probably too ambitious, so I would recommend having both an A and B portion of this class. I think while I learned a lot - I just wish I had more time with it in a class environment.
The class is much more Beckhoff-specific than the name implies. If the course is meant to be more generic, more time with other platforms would be helpful.
It's a new course. I would be excited to take it again in another few years, once we you have figured out what the best structure for is is.
Due dates were adjusted appropriately for some of the longer, or harder projects - so overall the workload was okay.

The projects were fairly sized, and the projects led well from one to the next. 

I wish there was a bit more connected work - developing a single piece of software from the beginning to end of the semester would have been nice.
Erich is always willing to help.
I don't see its usefulness in immediate future but I think it will become more useful once we integrate our systems with Beckhoff technology.
I don't think that is what this course if for, though...
Is it possible to fully understand Beckhoff?

I think having some resource other than Beckhoff website or Spencer's thesis would be more helpful. 
I have no idea what that would be but getting used to structured text and the software took me sometime. 
It wasn't until towards the end of the semester that I started to get used to the program.

It would be really nice to get some facetime with a Beckhoff Rep as a part of this course. To better understand how they look at entertainment, and to figure out some of the stranger parts of the software.
